programme.title: Pływające olbrzymy
programme.desc: Dwuczęściowy dokument przedstawia historię złotego okresu liniowców w żegludze morskiej. Do tych ogromnych i szybkich statków, wówczas będących ogromnym osiągnięciem technologicznymi, należały m.in. Astoria, Lusitatnia, Titanic. Na swoim pokładzie gościły przedstawicieli różnorodnych środowisk. W luksusowych kajutach podróżowali bogacze, a najubożsi byli skazani na okropne warunki w innych częściach okrętu.

programme.title: American Graffiti
Amerykańskie graffiti
American Graffiti
programme.desc:
American Graffiti: Directed by George Lucas. With Richard Dreyfuss, Ron Howard, Paul Le Mat, Charles Martin Smith. A group of teenagers in California's central valley spend one final night after their 1962 high school graduation cruising the strip with their buddies before they pursue their varying goals." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0069704/","name":"American Graffiti","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI5NjM5MjIyNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjg2MTUxMDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A group of teenagers in California's central valley spend one final night after their 1962 high school graduation cruising the strip with their buddies before they pursue their varying goals.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0069704/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"BruceCorneil"},"dateCreated":"2003-03-24","inLanguage":"English","name":"Thanks George Lucas !","reviewBody":"As the plot and the characters of this movie have already been thoroughly discussed elsewhere , perhaps I can just make one additional observation in regard to the wider influence that it had during its initial release.

Specifically, the outstanding success of this landmark film was largely (although not entirely) responsible for starting the "retro" craze that quickly grew into a major international subculture and is still going strong today. Although, back in the '70s we used the word "nostalgia". 

The movie's soundtrack album, which was nothing more than a compilation of 1950s and early 60s Top 40 hits, generated massive sales figures across the globe and immediately triggered a flood of similar vinyl offerings from other record companies. 

Being the ripe old age of 13 in 1973, I totally lost interest in the music of the day and started to collect many of the aforementioned compilation albums.

Again, as others have correctly pointed out, the initial retro scene was mainly confined to the musical side of things which included the establishment of "Oldies" radio stations. It wasn't long, however, before the general mood of nostalgia became more widespread with an increasing number of people becoming interested in other pop culture commodities of the era such as movies,TV shows, cars and clothes.

Pretty soon the whole thing exploded and the "Good Old Days" suddenly became big business. And why not? There's some fabulous entertainment to be found in the archives for those who care to look.

Give me 'dem ole' time movies any day of the week! In fact, when you look back, I think we owe a debt of gratitude to George Lucas and the gang for giving us "American Graffiti". It started a positive and enjoyable marketing trend which has brought a great deal of pleasure to millions over the years. And that's a pretty nice legacy for any movie to leave behind.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":86181,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.4},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"1973-08-11","keywords":"rock 'n' roll,car,california,street racing,1960s","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi613466393","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmU0ZGM5MzctNGVlYi00OWFkLTkzMDYtYjczM2U2ZGY0ZGQwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmU0ZGM5MzctNGVlYi00OWFkLTkzMDYtYjczM2U2ZGY0ZGQwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A couple of high school grads spend one final night cruising the strip with their buddies before they go off to college."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000377/","name":"Richard Dreyfuss"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000165/","name":"Ron Howard"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0494432/","name":"Paul Le Mat"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000184/","name":"George Lucas"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0071326/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0099634/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000184/","name":"George Lucas"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0441718/","name":"Gloria Katz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0404754/","name":"Willard Huyck"}],"duration":"PT1H50M"}</script><metacontent="

A group of teenagers in California's central valley spend one final night after their 1962 high school graduation cruising the strip with their buddies before they pursue their varying goals." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0069704/","name":"American Graffiti","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI5NjM5MjIyNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjg2MTUxMDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A group of teenagers in California's central valley spend one final night after their 1962 high school graduation cruising the strip with their buddies before they pursue their varying goals.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0069704/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"BruceCorneil","dateCreated":"2003-03-24","inLanguage":"English","name":"Thanks George Lucas !","reviewBody":"As the plot and the characters of this movie have already been thoroughly discussed elsewhere , perhaps I can just make one additional observation in regard to the wider influence that it had during its initial release.

Specifically, the outstanding success of this landmark film was largely (although not entirely) responsible for starting the "retro" craze that quickly grew into a major international subculture and is still going strong today. Although, back in the '70s we used the word "nostalgia". 

The movie's soundtrack album, which was nothing more than a compilation of 1950s and early 60s Top 40 hits, generated massive sales figures across the globe and immediately triggered a flood of similar vinyl offerings from other record companies. 

Being the ripe old age of 13 in 1973, I totally lost interest in the music of the day and started to collect many of the aforementioned compilation albums.

Again, as others have correctly pointed out, the initial retro scene was mainly confined to the musical side of things which included the establishment of "Oldies" radio stations. It wasn't long, however, before the general mood of nostalgia became more widespread with an increasing number of people becoming interested in other pop culture commodities of the era such as movies,TV shows, cars and clothes.

Pretty soon the whole thing exploded and the "Good Old Days" suddenly became big business. And why not? There's some fabulous entertainment to be found in the archives for those who care to look.

Give me 'dem ole' time movies any day of the week! In fact, when you look back, I think we owe a debt of gratitude to George Lucas and the gang for giving us "American Graffiti". It started a positive and enjoyable marketing trend which has brought a great deal of pleasure to millions over the years. And that's a pretty nice legacy for any movie to leave behind.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":86181,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.4,"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"1973-08-11","keywords":"rock 'n' roll,car,california,street racing,1960s","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi613466393","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmU0ZGM5MzctNGVlYi00OWFkLTkzMDYtYjczM2U2ZGY0ZGQwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmU0ZGM5MzctNGVlYi00OWFkLTkzMDYtYjczM2U2ZGY0ZGQwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A couple of high school grads spend one final night cruising the strip with their buddies before they go off to college.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000377/","name":"Richard Dreyfuss","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000165/","name":"Ron Howard","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0494432/","name":"Paul Le Mat"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000184/","name":"George Lucas"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0071326/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0099634/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000184/","name":"George Lucas","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0441718/","name":"Gloria Katz","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0404754/","name":"Willard Huyck"],"duration":"PT1H50M"</script><metacontent="

The Letter Room
programme.desc: Dobroduszny, ale samotny Richard (Oscar Isaac) zostaje dyrektorem więzienia. Teraz musi przeglądać całą korespondencję osadzonych. Czytając ich listy, zaczyna bliżej poznawać prywatne sprawy podopiecznych. Interesuje się zwłaszcza skazańcem znajdującym się w celi śmierci. Postanawia podjąć działania, które wydają mu się słuszne.

programme.desc: Najśmieszniejsze fragmenty z programów polskich stacji TV: gafy popełniane przez prezenterów, ich nietypowe zachowania przed kamerą oraz awarie techniczne powodujące absurdalne sytuacje.

programme.title: Wysoki Pressing
programme.desc: Prowadzony w lekkiej formule telewizji śniadaniowej program poświęcony piłce nożnej. Gospodarz wraz z gośćmi omówi najważniejsze boiskowe wydarzenia, nie zabraknie też wnikliwych analiz i gorących dyskusji. Prowadzącymi na zmianę będą Daria Kabała-Malarz i Michał Kołodziejczyk.

programme.title: Turbokozak

programme.title: THE LEGENDS z Tomkiem Ćwiąkałą
programme.desc: Cykl wywiadów przeprowadzanych przez Tomka Ćwiąkałę z ważnymi postaciami ze świata futbolu. Wśród nich są mistrzowie świata, Europy i gwiazdy topowych lig. Widzowie dowiedzą się, czym zajmują się dzisiaj, jak wspominają swoje kariery oraz poznają ich plany na przyszłość.

programme.title: Zielona rewolucja Marty Dymek
programme.desc: Popularna blogerka Marta Dymek w każdym odcinku próbuje przekonać zaproszonego gościa do kuchni wegetariańskiej. Prowadząca pokaże, jak zastąpić potrawy mięsne ich jarskimi wariacjami.

programme.title: Bitwa na smaki: David vs Matteo 3
programme.desc: David Gaboriaud I Matteo Brunetti po raz trzeci staną do kulinarnego pojedynku. W każdym odcinku kucharze zaprezentują swoje umiejętności w próbie przygotowanej przez przybyłych do studia gości.

programme.title: Bitwa na smaki: David vs Matteo 3
programme.desc: David Gaboriaud I Matteo Brunetti po raz trzeci staną do kulinarnego pojedynku. W każdym odcinku kucharze zaprezentują swoje umiejętności w próbie przygotowanej przez przybyłych do studia gości.

programme.title: Gdzie rosną pieniądze
programme.desc: Praktyczny poradnik w duchu zero waste. Joanna Dymmel, autorka książki "Gdzie rosną pieniądze", udowadnia, że domy i mieszkania są pełne rzeczy, na których można zarobić. W szafach, na pawlaczach, na strychach, w piwnicach czy garażach zalegają przedmioty, które mogą być źródłem dodatkowej gotówki. Prowadząca odwiedzi widzów, by pomóc im wybrać, wycenić i przygotować do sprzedaży rozmaite rzeczy, mogące przynieść zysk bez wychodzenia z domu.

programme.title: Odyseja po greckich wyspach
A Greek Odyssey with Bettany Hughes
News+
programme.desc: Podsumowanie najważniejszych wydarzeń z aren sportowych. Omówienie sukcesów, rekordów i porażek. Program prowadzą zamiennie m.in. Piotr Karpiński, Piotr Salak, Wojciech Zawioła i Gabriel Rogaczewski.

programme.title: Mistrzowie przekąsek w akcji 2
programme.desc: Fred Sirieix po raz kolejny sprawdzi, jak szefowie kuchni poradzą sobie z rzuconymi przez niego wyzwaniami. Zadaniem uczestników programu będzie przygotowanie przekąsek, które uwielbiają Brytyjczycy. Ich pracę ocenią pracownicy fabryk, w których produkuje się dany przysmak.

programme.title: Polska z góry. Zamki, dworki, pałace
Polska z góry. Zamki, dworki, pałace
Tajemnice Kleopatry
programme.desc: Archeolożka Kathleen Martinez wyrusza na wyprawę mającą na celu zbadanie tajemnic Kleopatry, legendarnej władczyni Egiptu, której wizerunek często znany jest ludziom jedynie przez pryzmat kulturowych stereotypów kreowanych m.in. przez Hollywood. Badaczka wykorzystuje najnowocześniejsze zdobycze techniki, by odszukać grobowiec ze szczątkami królowej. Ma nadzieję, że znajdzie go wśród ruin świątyni starożytnego portu Taposiris Magna.

Especially as he has a goal that must be hidden at all costs." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6882604/","name":"Archive","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzFkNTRiMzYtODM2MS00YWQ2LThkNTUtMDE1Y2E2YjAwYTUxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzQwMTY2Nzk@._V1_.jpg","description":"2038: George Almore is working on a true human-equivalent AI. Especially as he has a goal that must be hidden at all costs.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6882604/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"mhodgson66"},"dateCreated":"2021-01-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"Slow burn sci-fi","reviewBody":"As a sci-fi fan, I found this admittedly derivative film extremely enjoyable. It is stylishly shot, directed and acted with aplomb by the attractive and enigmatic leads of Theo James and Stacy Martin. Indeed, the latter is well cast in her role who is both ambiguous, childlike and yet empathetic all at the same time. The wonderful Toby Jones also turns up in an extended cameo just to give it that bit extra. If you want wham, bang, action this is definitely not for you. However, if you enjoy psychological, moody sci-fi with stunning visuals then there is much you will enjoy. It is very 'Twilight Zone' with an ending I didn't anticipate.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":17761,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"contentRating":"TV-MA","genre":["Drama","Mystery","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2020-07-10","keywords":"dead wife,husband wife relationship,fatal car accident,artificial intelligence,surprise ending","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3911368217","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDg2ZTIxNDItM2Y4OC00YThiLTkwYmQtMjcxZWUwYTRjM2NlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDg2ZTIxNDItM2Y4OC00YThiLTkwYmQtMjcxZWUwYTRjM2NlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"2038: George Almore is working on a true human-equivalent AI. programme.title: Crypto
Krypto. Strach to najtrudniejsza waluta
Crypto
programme.desc:
Crypto: Directed by John Stalberg Jr.. With Beau Knapp, Luke Hemsworth, Jill Hennessy, Alexis Bledel. Demoted back to his hometown, a young Wall Street banker is drawn into investigating a tangled web of corruption and fraud in Upstate New York, affecting both his personal life and business career." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8563452/","name":"Crypto","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2I3YjljOTMtNTg0Ny00NDdhLTlkODUtMzEwMzMwZWNkZTIwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyOTg4MDYyNw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Demoted back to his hometown, a young Wall Street banker is drawn into investigating a tangled web of corruption and fraud in Upstate New York, affecting both his personal life and business career.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8563452/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Top_Dawg_Critic"},"dateCreated":"2019-04-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"Three writers, and you'd think at least one would get it right","reviewBody":"I get that all three writers are amateurs, but didn't the producers at least pick up on the need for a fine tune/re-write of this convoluted mess of a script?

There's little story that actually makes any sense amongst a ton of buzz words no one will understand in the entire 105 mins of this film, and for that length of time, certainly some unnecessary scenes could've been omitted and others (including the buzz word scenes) elaborated upon. It was never made clear what Martins full duty was, or why he left the big city head office, and so on. It's as if a 5+ hour decent screenplay was shredded, and random pieces put together to total the final runtime. I could go on and on, but it's such a shame no one invested in a seasoned screenwriter to at least fine tune the script, as this production had many decent values to it. The pacing was also slow for my liking, and this film needed to be trimmed down to 90 mins (with a proper script) or played back at 1.2x speed.

The directing/camera work was well executed. The acting by all leads was spot on and convincing, but casting Beau Knapp as Martin was another big mistake. He didn't suit that role/character, and his acting was way too bland. He'd been better off being cast as one of the thugs, instead of pretty much sleeping in his suit trying to act like a white collar exec.

The score was too outstanding for this film... I mean top notch, and created some great tension and suspense, but seemed overbearing next to the convoluted plot.

Aside from that, unless you have any idea about crypto currency and forensic accounting (luckily I do, and I was still confused), you'll lose interest in this film pretty fast.

Really too bad considering everything else was done really well. Sadly, it's only a generous 6/10 from me.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":5220,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.3},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Crime","Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2019-04-12","keywords":"corruption,cryptocurrency,wall street,new york,money laundering","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Crypto","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4005870617","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTBiN2M0MTYtZjNlZS00ZWYxLWFiZTYtOGU1M2ViNTIwZTU4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTBiN2M0MTYtZjNlZS00ZWYxLWFiZTYtOGU1M2ViNTIwZTU4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Official Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3354041/","name":"Beau Knapp"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1292661/","name":"Luke Hemsworth"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005007/","name":"Jill Hennessy"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1226069/","name":"John Stalberg Jr."}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0303286/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0474730/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0642596/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5673221/","name":"Carlyle Eubank"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0295701/","name":"David Frigerio"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm9912021/","name":"Jeff Ingber"}],"duration":"PT1H45M"}</script><metacontent="

There's little story that actually makes any sense amongst a ton of buzz words no one will understand in the entire 105 mins of this film, and for that length of time, certainly some unnecessary scenes could've been omitted and others (including the buzz word scenes) elaborated upon. programme.title: W spirali
W spirali
programme.desc: W spirali: Directed by Konrad Aksinowicz. With Piotr Stramowski, Katarzyna Warnke, Olga Boladz, Antoni Królikowski. An out of town car trip, which was meant to have a purifying effect on the trouble-stricken married couple, turns into a dangerous interaction between characters when they pick up an eccentric traveler, Tamir. Tamir is a witness to, and a catalyst of their problems, a self-appointed healer wishing to become their path to enlightenment. Krzysztof and Agnes know they shouldn't be together but they are unable to part, or perhaps they do not want to? "Into the Spiral" is a story of love which is restless, dangerous and toxic." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt4092514/","name":"W spirali","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWY3M2NjNWMtNzY3MC00NGY3LWJiNTMtMWEyZTBmZjc4OGJlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjY0OTk2NzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"An out of town car trip, which was meant to have a purifying effect on the trouble-stricken married couple, turns into a dangerous interaction between characters when they pick up an eccentric traveler, Tamir. programme.title: Papusza
Papusza
programme.desc: Papusza: Directed by Joanna Kos-Krauze, Krzysztof Krauze. With Jowita Budnik, Zbigniew Walerys, Antoni Pawlicki, Artur Steranko. The rise and fall of the most distinguished Polish-Gypsy poetess Bronislawa Wajs, widely known as Papusza, and her relationship with her discoverer, writer Jerzy Ficowski." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2719094/","name":"Papusza","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODc0ODZlNTctZDRiNS00MDY1LTgzMzAtMjA1YzIyN2U5ZGEwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzMzMjU5NDY@._V1_.jpg","description":"The rise and fall of the most distinguished Polish-Gypsy poetess Bronislawa Wajs, widely known as Papusza, and her relationship with her discoverer, writer Jerzy Ficowski.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2719094/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"davidy46"},"dateCreated":"2015-04-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"One of the most beautiful and moving films I've ever seen","reviewBody":"Can't quite understand how this film got overlooked for an Oscar. It got a rave review in a Danish newspaper when it was doing the rounds here in March 2015, so my wife and I went to see it. Just beautifully filmed and acted - a very moving portrait of a people whom I knew nothing about previously. When I came out, I was on the verge of revising my choice of Fanny and Alexander as my favourite film; I was so in awe of what I had just seen. Sadly, Krzysztof Krauze, the co-director, died at Christmas 2014. I have been in touch with the Polish Film Institute to see if a DVD with English sub-titles is available, but it isn't yet, despite it being shown at the London Film Festival. Let's hope something is done about that - I'd buy several copies as gifts for friends. If you get a chance to see it, don't miss it. "Ida" deservedly got a lot of good reviews and even the Oscar for Best Foreign Film. This one is much better.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1296,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.4},"contentRating":"G","genre":["Biography","Drama"],"datePublished":"2013-11-15","keywords":"character name as title,nickname as title,papusza character,poetess,title directed by female","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0591858/","name":"Jowita Budnik"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1138580/","name":"Zbigniew Walerys"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2252397/","name":"Antoni Pawlicki"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1732806/","name":"Joanna Kos-Krauze"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0470377/","name":"Krzysztof Krauze"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0330220/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0043688/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049230/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1732806/","name":"Joanna Kos-Krauze"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0470377/","name":"Krzysztof Krauze"}],"duration":"PT2H11M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 2719094, Title: Papusza, --- Description: Papusza: Directed by Joanna Kos-Krauze, Krzysztof Krauze. With Jowita Budnik, Zbigniew Walerys, Antoni Pawlicki, Artur Steranko. The rise and fall of the most distinguished Polish-Gypsy poetess Bronislawa Wajs, widely known as Papusza, and her relationship with her discoverer, writer Jerzy Ficowski." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2719094/","name":"Papusza","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODc0ODZlNTctZDRiNS00MDY1LTgzMzAtMjA1YzIyN2U5ZGEwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzMzMjU5NDY@._V1_.jpg","description":"The rise and fall of the most distinguished Polish-Gypsy poetess Bronislawa Wajs, widely known as Papusza, and her relationship with her discoverer, writer Jerzy Ficowski.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2719094/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"davidy46","dateCreated":"2015-04-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"One of the most beautiful and moving films I've ever seen","reviewBody":"Can't quite understand how this film got overlooked for an Oscar. It got a rave review in a Danish newspaper when it was doing the rounds here in March 2015, so my wife and I went to see it. Just beautifully filmed and acted - a very moving portrait of a people whom I knew nothing about previously. When I came out, I was on the verge of revising my choice of Fanny and Alexander as my favourite film; I was so in awe of what I had just seen. Sadly, Krzysztof Krauze, the co-director, died at Christmas 2014. I have been in touch with the Polish Film Institute to see if a DVD with English sub-titles is available, but it isn't yet, despite it being shown at the London Film Festival. Let's hope something is done about that - I'd buy several copies as gifts for friends. If you get a chance to see it, don't miss it. "Ida" deservedly got a lot of good reviews and even the Oscar for Best Foreign Film. This one is much better.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1296,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.4,"contentRating":"G","genre":["Biography","Drama"],"datePublished":"2013-11-15","keywords":"character name as title,nickname as title,papusza character,poetess,title directed by female","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0591858/","name":"Jowita Budnik","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1138580/","name":"Zbigniew Walerys","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2252397/","name":"Antoni Pawlicki"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1732806/","name":"Joanna Kos-Krauze","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0470377/","name":"Krzysztof Krauze"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0330220/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0043688/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049230/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1732806/","name":"Joanna Kos-Krauze","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0470377/","name":"Krzysztof Krauze"],"duration":"PT2H11M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Elizabeth Is Missing
Ani śladu Elizabeth
Elizabeth Is Missing
programme.desc:
Elizabeth Is Missing: Directed by Aisling Walsh. With Glenda Jackson, Maggie Steed, Sophie Rundle, Liv Hill. A woman affected by dementia struggles to solve the disappearance of her friend." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8201352/","name":"Elizabeth Is Missing","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTkwYWQ5YTYtOWMxMC00YTc5LWJjNDItZDJjMmM1MjkyZGM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjg0NTcxMTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"A woman affected by dementia struggles to solve the disappearance of her friend.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8201352/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"michael-phillips-55838"},"dateCreated":"2019-12-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"Sad reality drama with a twist","reviewBody":"It must be said when it comes to making dramas the BBC very rarely fails. This was brilliant.

Maud is a mother and grandmother tackling life's daily challenges only in reality she is in the depths of dementia. The story centres around Maud trying to find her friend Elizabeth who has gone missing. Nobody seems to care apart from Maud and the frustration she feels is very evident. The current events are also triggering past memories of another missing person in Maud's life but I won't say anymore about that.

Glenda Jackson is absolutely amazing as Maud. My husband actually asked me if she has dementia in real life, her performance is so convincing.

Losing a parent to dementia is a fear every person must contemplate at some point and this drama echoes that fear with unabashed realism.

This is an emotional ride you won't forget in a hurry. A must see.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2329,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.5},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2019-12-08","keywords":"dementia,senior citizen,missing person,flashback,alzheimer's disease","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0413559/","name":"Glenda Jackson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0824353/","name":"Maggie Steed"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2570706/","name":"Sophie Rundle"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0909532/","name":"Aisling Walsh"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0234667/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0271278/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0316447/","name":"Andrea Gibb"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm9731109/","name":"Emma Healey"}],"duration":"PT1H27M"}</script><metacontent="

A woman affected by dementia struggles to solve the disappearance of her friend." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8201352/","name":"Elizabeth Is Missing","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTkwYWQ5YTYtOWMxMC00YTc5LWJjNDItZDJjMmM1MjkyZGM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjg0NTcxMTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"A woman affected by dementia struggles to solve the disappearance of her friend.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8201352/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"michael-phillips-55838","dateCreated":"2019-12-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"Sad reality drama with a twist","reviewBody":"It must be said when it comes to making dramas the BBC very rarely fails. This was brilliant.

Maud is a mother and grandmother tackling life's daily challenges only in reality she is in the depths of dementia. The story centres around Maud trying to find her friend Elizabeth who has gone missing. Nobody seems to care apart from Maud and the frustration she feels is very evident. The current events are also triggering past memories of another missing person in Maud's life but I won't say anymore about that.

Glenda Jackson is absolutely amazing as Maud. My husband actually asked me if she has dementia in real life, her performance is so convincing.

Losing a parent to dementia is a fear every person must contemplate at some point and this drama echoes that fear with unabashed realism.

This is an emotional ride you won't forget in a hurry. A must see.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2329,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.5,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2019-12-08","keywords":"dementia,senior citizen,missing person,flashback,alzheimer's disease","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0413559/","name":"Glenda Jackson","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0824353/","name":"Maggie Steed","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2570706/","name":"Sophie Rundle"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0909532/","name":"Aisling Walsh"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0234667/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0271278/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0316447/","name":"Andrea Gibb","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm9731109/","name":"Emma Healey"],"duration":"PT1H27M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Odio l'estate
Jak ja nienawidzę wakacji!
Odio l'estate
programme.desc: Odio l'estate: Directed by Massimo Venier. With Aldo Baglio, Giovanni Storti, Giacomo Poretti, Lucia Mascino. Three families end up in the same rented house. Throughout the summer, they become friends and rediscover how to enjoy life." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt10492998/","name":"Odio l'estate","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2Q5ZDdmZWItMmNiYi00MjU5LThmOTAtZDU5N2ZhYmM1NDAzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTY5OTQzNzY@._V1_.jpg","description":"Three families end up in the same rented house. Throughout the summer, they become friends and rediscover how to enjoy life.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10492998/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"antoniotierno"},"dateCreated":"2020-02-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"excellent return","reviewBody":"A few years after the not so succesfull experiment of "Fuga da Reuma Park", after the celebrations for 25 years of activity together and after Aldo Baglio had started working alone (that seemed to be the beginning of the end of the Trio), here they go with a surprise new film, bringing the three guys back in the wake of a solid and mature comedy, which gets to speak to the hearts of old fans but maybe also able to conquer new ones. Certainly a bittersweet reflection on the passing of time and the risk of forgetting who we are, the story well written, funny and at times even moving, The film features three unexpectedly excellent first ladies, perfectly at ease in their meeting with Aldo Giovanni and Giacomo as well as the return of their historic director, who still knows how to make the most of their potential.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2309,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2020-01-30","keywords":"friend","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer [OVS]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3128737305","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTA5Y2E2MWUtMTdkYS00NjI3LTg0NzQtNTZmZmQwMjA0MDc3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTA5Y2E2MWUtMTdkYS00NjI3LTg0NzQtNTZmZmQwMjA0MDc3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0017623/","name":"Aldo Baglio"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0320495/","name":"Giovanni Storti"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0316034/","name":"Giacomo Poretti"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0893111/","name":"Massimo Venier"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0043281/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0117688/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0254125/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3291357/","name":"Davide Lantieri"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1614496/","name":"Michele Pellegrini"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0893111/","name":"Massimo Venier"}],"duration":"PT1H50M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: A Walk in the Clouds
Spacer w chmurach
A Walk in the Clouds
programme.desc: A Walk in the Clouds: Directed by Alfonso Arau. With Keanu Reeves, Aitana Sánchez-Gijón, Anthony Quinn, Giancarlo Giannini. A married soldier returning from World War II poses as a pregnant woman's husband to save her from her father's anger and honor." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0114887/","name":"A Walk in the Clouds","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGQ5NzI2NWQtODVjZi00NDk1LTg1NmMtZDVlNWMwODZmNGI4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjUzOTY1NTc@._V1_.jpg","description":"A married soldier returning from World War II poses as a pregnant woman's husband to save her from her father's anger and honor.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0114887/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"moviebuff"},"dateCreated":"2001-02-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"A charming romance for a more cynical time","reviewBody":"You often hear people lament:"they don't make them like they used to". This film is one of those magical examples where they really do. Alfonso Arau has given us one of the most poignant, old-fashioned romance films in many a year. Set in the Napa Valley shortly after the end of World War II, Keanu Reeves and Aitana Sanchez-Gijon play two people searching for their futures. Reeves as an ex-GI in a pointless job with a wife he hardly knows and Sanchez-Gijon as a pregnant and abandoned woman afraid to face the shame she will bring to her family. They agree to pose as a married couple in order for her to save face and placate the anticipated anger of her stern father. What follows is a lovingly realized story of family, love and understanding played out against the beauty of the northern California wine country. The vineyard owned by Sanchez-Gijon's family is pure fantasy created by some wonderful visual effects but it provides the perfect setting for the film. There are moments in this film of sensual beauty every bit as breathtaking as the vineyard itself. One of the great joys of this film is the performance of Anthony Quinn as Don Pedro, Sanchez-Gijon's grandfather. He steals every scene he's in. His performance is funny and charming and his character always has a knowing twinkle in his eye. A pure delight to watch. For those with unjaded hearts, settle down with the one you love and share a glass of wine as you watch this film and relish it's pure heart and the exquisite joy of it's touching romance."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":33179,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"1995-08-11","keywords":"falling in love,1940s,aftermath of world war ii,war aftermath,helping someone","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"A Walk In The Clouds","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3904110873","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2FlOTU3OGUtZjZkZC00ZjRjLTljMWMtMTVkNDg2MmVlMDQzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2FlOTU3OGUtZjZkZC00ZjRjLTljMWMtMTVkNDg2MmVlMDQzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000206/","name":"Keanu Reeves"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0845209/","name":"Aitana Sánchez-Gijón"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000063/","name":"Anthony Quinn"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000778/","name":"Alfonso Arau"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0042359/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0436543/","name":"Robert Mark Kamen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0588903/","name":"Mark Miller"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0919386/","name":"Harvey Weitzman"}],"duration":"PT1H42M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Living Daylights
W obliczu śmierci
The Living Daylights
programme.desc:
The Living Daylights: Directed by John Glen. With Timothy Dalton, Maryam d'Abo, Jeroen Krabbé, Joe Don Baker. James Bond is sent to investigate a KGB policy to kill all enemy spies and uncovers an arms deal that potentially has major global ramifications." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0093428/","name":"The Living Daylights","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjI4MjBmYzItYTY5OC00OWYzLWE0NWYtZDQxNDQxM2QzYjA4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjc1NTYyMjg@._V1_.jpg","description":"James Bond is sent to investigate a KGB policy to kill all enemy spies and uncovers an arms deal that potentially has major global ramifications.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0093428/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Fella_shibby"},"dateCreated":"2021-05-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"One of my fav Bond movie.","reviewBody":"I first saw this in the early 90s on a vhs.

Revisited it recently.

This the fifteenth in the Bond series and the first of two to star Timothy Dalton as James Bond.

In this movie Bond is assigned to help a KGB General to defect and facilitate his escape via Trans-Siberian Pipeline across the border to the West.

Later Bond is directed to kill the new head of the KGB who is responsible for reviving the program 'Smiert Spionam', meaning 'Death to Spies'.

Bond takes it upon himself to forestall further killings of agents after learning that his colleague 004 was assassinated cos of this program.

In this movie Bond has to deal with Brad Whitaker, an international black market arms dealer from the United States who always wears a US military uniform but his actual military career is a failure, so he turns to arms dealing to organize his own personal military force.

Bond also has to deal with Georgi Koskov, a deceitful, mastermind and sociopathic Soviet general in business for himself, who is playing both sides of the Cold War.

Bond faces Colonel Feyador, a commander of a Soviet airfield in Afghanistan and his sadistic prison guard.

Bond also deals with an anonymous assassin during a training exercise but the most dangerous enforcer Bond has to deal is Necros which means death. Necros is an international mercenary and former KGB agent in the employ of General Koskov and Brad Whitaker.

With the exception of Kell Tyler, the Bond in this movie is basically monogamous throughout the entire film, with the sole other Bond girl, Maryam d'Abo.

But this movie has Rubavitch (Virginia Hey), the stunning mistress of the new KGB head whose partial nudity is witnessed by Bond n a guard. Lucky fellas man.

This one has a fast paced pre-title sequence where skydiving British agents are tasked with penetrating radar installations atop the Rock of Gibraltar as part of a Ministry of Defence training exercise and the agents are stalked by an assassin.

This one also has an action packed climax n the aerial scenes are tension filled.

Connery's personality n voice and Moore's jocular approach will always be missed but Dalton did a good job in portraying the no nonsense serious tone.

The only weak thing in this movie is the villain, General Whitaker, a phony general who plays with toy soldiers and never seems truly diabolical.

IMDb data; ttnr: 0093428, Title: The Living Daylights, --- Description: The Living Daylights: Directed by John Glen. With Timothy Dalton, Maryam d'Abo, Jeroen Krabbé, Joe Don Baker. James Bond is sent to investigate a KGB policy to kill all enemy spies and uncovers an arms deal that potentially has major global ramifications." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0093428/","name":"The Living Daylights","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjI4MjBmYzItYTY5OC00OWYzLWE0NWYtZDQxNDQxM2QzYjA4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjc1NTYyMjg@._V1_.jpg","description":"James Bond is sent to investigate a KGB policy to kill all enemy spies and uncovers an arms deal that potentially has major global ramifications.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0093428/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"Fella_shibby","dateCreated":"2021-05-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"One of my fav Bond movie.","reviewBody":"I first saw this in the early 90s on a vhs.

Revisited it recently.

This the fifteenth in the Bond series and the first of two to star Timothy Dalton as James Bond.

In this movie Bond is assigned to help a KGB General to defect and facilitate his escape via Trans-Siberian Pipeline across the border to the West.

Later Bond is directed to kill the new head of the KGB who is responsible for reviving the program 'Smiert Spionam', meaning 'Death to Spies'.

Bond takes it upon himself to forestall further killings of agents after learning that his colleague 004 was assassinated cos of this program.

In this movie Bond has to deal with Brad Whitaker, an international black market arms dealer from the United States who always wears a US military uniform but his actual military career is a failure, so he turns to arms dealing to organize his own personal military force.

Bond also has to deal with Georgi Koskov, a deceitful, mastermind and sociopathic Soviet general in business for himself, who is playing both sides of the Cold War.

Bond faces Colonel Feyador, a commander of a Soviet airfield in Afghanistan and his sadistic prison guard.

Bond also deals with an anonymous assassin during a training exercise but the most dangerous enforcer Bond has to deal is Necros which means death. Necros is an international mercenary and former KGB agent in the employ of General Koskov and Brad Whitaker.

With the exception of Kell Tyler, the Bond in this movie is basically monogamous throughout the entire film, with the sole other Bond girl, Maryam d'Abo.

But this movie has Rubavitch (Virginia Hey), the stunning mistress of the new KGB head whose partial nudity is witnessed by Bond n a guard. Lucky fellas man.

This one has a fast paced pre-title sequence where skydiving British agents are tasked with penetrating radar installations atop the Rock of Gibraltar as part of a Ministry of Defence training exercise and the agents are stalked by an assassin.

This one also has an action packed climax n the aerial scenes are tension filled.

Connery's personality n voice and Moore's jocular approach will always be missed but Dalton did a good job in portraying the no nonsense serious tone.

The only weak thing in this movie is the villain, General Whitaker, a phony general who plays with toy soldiers and never seems truly diabolical.

I expected a Enter The Dragon style confrontation where the General hides behind the statues n i at least expected some insult shown towards the statue of Hitler.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":94706,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7,"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Action","Adventure","Thriller"],"datePublished":"1987-06-30","keywords":"defection,soviet afghanistan war,betrayal,afghanistan,returning character with different actor","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4162371097","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGUzNDA3YmYtYWNiZS00YjAxLTk3OTEtMTM5MWFhMjI2ZjVhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGUzNDA3YmYtYWNiZS00YjAxLTk3OTEtMTM5MWFhMjI2ZjVhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001096/","name":"Timothy Dalton","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001881/","name":"Maryam d'Abo","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0469103/","name":"Jeroen Krabbé"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0322515/","name":"John Glen"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054040/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0537363/","name":"Richard Maibaum","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0933865/","name":"Michael G. programme.title: Licence to Kill
Licencja na zabijanie
Licence to Kill
programme.desc:
Licence to Kill: Directed by John Glen. With Timothy Dalton, Carey Lowell, Robert Davi, Talisa Soto. A vengeful James Bond goes rogue to infiltrate and take down the organization of a drug lord who has murdered his friend's new wife and left him near-death." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0097742/","name":"Licence to Kill","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODY3M2I0NGItYzJhNy00M2NiLThhMDgtNjZkNjA1NTQzMDM4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTIzOTk5ODM@._V1_.jpg","description":"A vengeful James Bond goes rogue to infiltrate and take down the organization of a drug lord who has murdered his friend's new wife and left him near-death.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0097742/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"eamon-hennedy"},"dateCreated":"2003-10-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"CLASSIC BOND!","reviewBody":"I really liked Timothy Dalton as Bond. I really thought the guy did a great job. The Living Daylights was an excellent Bond thriller, more in line with Dr No and From Russia With Love in tone and style, but with Licence To Kill you can tell that Broccoli decided to compete with the big boys with this action packed spectacular that aims high and scores. What we have here is Bond with spectacular action scenes and a more nastier steak with regards to the violence that is more in line with Hollywood action blockbusters than with quintessential British spies. This is why the film works. Licence To Kill is much more darker than any of the Bond films that has come before, and after the silliness of the Moore era, that was what this franchise needed. Why have world domination craving villains when you can just p*ss Bond off, big time. Having Felix Lieter maimed and his wife killed on their wedding day is inspired and immediately puts the film on a darker streak. The script here is very strong as we watch a darker more violent Bond infiltrate the bad guy's lifestyle and then proceed to work from there.

 Don't make any mistakes this is not a Bond film that would be broadcast during a Bank Holiday afternoon. What we have here is a film that is graphically violent. Check out the head explosion scene or the nasty incidents involving sharks. Having Bond on the revenge path makes for a more interesting tale than just another villain trying to take over the world. The more personal element fits in with this more darker Bond. Dalton really rises to the occasion here and ensures that he will be remembered as a fine actor who played the part of James Bond. The ice cool look of anger as he dumps a bad guy into a shark tank with a case fool of money is fantastic as is his reaction to finding Lieter's dead wife. It may not be said, buy OHMSS is being referenced. Helping Dalton along the way is a great support cast. Robert Davi is superb as Franz Sanchez, without doubt the nastiest Bond villain there has ever been. We have two Bond girls too. Talisa Soto is beautifully sultry, but Carey Lowell just pips her to the post as Pam Bouvier who really gives Bond a run for his money. Another great casting point is an increased role for Q. Desmond Lewellyn appears here more than he ever has done before, helping out in the mission that makes one wonder the Bond writers never thought of it before, or why they never did it after.

Licence To Kill is classic Bond. Purists may give of with the more American touch to the narrative (you just know that any theatrical trailer is crying out for voice over man to go "this time it's personal"), but the more darker narrative suits the film and it shows that Dalton was a good Bond no matter what his critics say. With some of the most spectacular action sequences at the time, this is a genuine Bond classic.

Shaken and stirred most definitely.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":100484,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Thriller"],"datePublished":"1989-07-14","keywords":"personal vendetta,vengeance,drug cartel,official james bond series,felix leiter character","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Licence to Kill","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2476317465","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmFmMWVlNmEtZTQ5Zi00ZTBmLWFlMTgtZWQwODg1NTI1OWYxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmFmMWVlNmEtZTQ5Zi00ZTBmLWFlMTgtZWQwODg1NTI1OWYxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer 2 for Licence To Kill"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001096/","name":"Timothy Dalton"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001108/","name":"Robert Davi"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000508/","name":"Carey Lowell"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0322515/","name":"John Glen"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0024134/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054040/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0026841/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0933865/","name":"Michael G. Wilson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0537363/","name":"Richard Maibaum"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001220/","name":"Ian Fleming"}],"duration":"PT2H13M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Living Daylights
W obliczu śmierci
The Living Daylights
programme.desc:
The Living Daylights: Directed by John Glen. With Timothy Dalton, Maryam d'Abo, Jeroen Krabbé, Joe Don Baker. James Bond is sent to investigate a KGB policy to kill all enemy spies and uncovers an arms deal that potentially has major global ramifications." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0093428/","name":"The Living Daylights","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjI4MjBmYzItYTY5OC00OWYzLWE0NWYtZDQxNDQxM2QzYjA4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjc1NTYyMjg@._V1_.jpg","description":"James Bond is sent to investigate a KGB policy to kill all enemy spies and uncovers an arms deal that potentially has major global ramifications.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0093428/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Fella_shibby"},"dateCreated":"2021-05-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"One of my fav Bond movie.","reviewBody":"I first saw this in the early 90s on a vhs.

Revisited it recently.

This the fifteenth in the Bond series and the first of two to star Timothy Dalton as James Bond.

In this movie Bond is assigned to help a KGB General to defect and facilitate his escape via Trans-Siberian Pipeline across the border to the West.

Later Bond is directed to kill the new head of the KGB who is responsible for reviving the program 'Smiert Spionam', meaning 'Death to Spies'.

Bond takes it upon himself to forestall further killings of agents after learning that his colleague 004 was assassinated cos of this program.

In this movie Bond has to deal with Brad Whitaker, an international black market arms dealer from the United States who always wears a US military uniform but his actual military career is a failure, so he turns to arms dealing to organize his own personal military force.

Bond also has to deal with Georgi Koskov, a deceitful, mastermind and sociopathic Soviet general in business for himself, who is playing both sides of the Cold War.

Bond faces Colonel Feyador, a commander of a Soviet airfield in Afghanistan and his sadistic prison guard.

Bond also deals with an anonymous assassin during a training exercise but the most dangerous enforcer Bond has to deal is Necros which means death. Necros is an international mercenary and former KGB agent in the employ of General Koskov and Brad Whitaker.

With the exception of Kell Tyler, the Bond in this movie is basically monogamous throughout the entire film, with the sole other Bond girl, Maryam d'Abo.

But this movie has Rubavitch (Virginia Hey), the stunning mistress of the new KGB head whose partial nudity is witnessed by Bond n a guard. Lucky fellas man.

This one has a fast paced pre-title sequence where skydiving British agents are tasked with penetrating radar installations atop the Rock of Gibraltar as part of a Ministry of Defence training exercise and the agents are stalked by an assassin.

This one also has an action packed climax n the aerial scenes are tension filled.

Connery's personality n voice and Moore's jocular approach will always be missed but Dalton did a good job in portraying the no nonsense serious tone.

The only weak thing in this movie is the villain, General Whitaker, a phony general who plays with toy soldiers and never seems truly diabolical.

I expected a Enter The Dragon style confrontation where the General hides behind the statues n i at least expected some insult shown towards the statue of Hitler.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":94706,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Action","Adventure","Thriller"],"datePublished":"1987-06-30","keywords":"defection,soviet afghanistan war,betrayal,afghanistan,returning character with different actor","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4162371097","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGUzNDA3YmYtYWNiZS00YjAxLTk3OTEtMTM5MWFhMjI2ZjVhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGUzNDA3YmYtYWNiZS00YjAxLTk3OTEtMTM5MWFhMjI2ZjVhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001096/","name":"Timothy Dalton"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001881/","name":"Maryam d'Abo"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0469103/","name":"Jeroen Krabbé"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0322515/","name":"John Glen"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054040/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0537363/","name":"Richard Maibaum"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0933865/","name":"Michael G. Wilson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001220/","name":"Ian Fleming"}],"duration":"PT2H10M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Licence to Kill
Licencja na zabijanie
Licence to Kill
programme.desc:
Licence to Kill: Directed by John Glen. With Timothy Dalton, Carey Lowell, Robert Davi, Talisa Soto. A vengeful James Bond goes rogue to infiltrate and take down the organization of a drug lord who has murdered his friend's new wife and left him near-death." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0097742/","name":"Licence to Kill","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODY3M2I0NGItYzJhNy00M2NiLThhMDgtNjZkNjA1NTQzMDM4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTIzOTk5ODM@._V1_.jpg","description":"A vengeful James Bond goes rogue to infiltrate and take down the organization of a drug lord who has murdered his friend's new wife and left him near-death.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0097742/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"eamon-hennedy"},"dateCreated":"2003-10-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"CLASSIC BOND!","reviewBody":"I really liked Timothy Dalton as Bond. I really thought the guy did a great job. The Living Daylights was an excellent Bond thriller, more in line with Dr No and From Russia With Love in tone and style, but with Licence To Kill you can tell that Broccoli decided to compete with the big boys with this action packed spectacular that aims high and scores. What we have here is Bond with spectacular action scenes and a more nastier steak with regards to the violence that is more in line with Hollywood action blockbusters than with quintessential British spies. This is why the film works. Licence To Kill is much more darker than any of the Bond films that has come before, and after the silliness of the Moore era, that was what this franchise needed. Why have world domination craving villains when you can just p*ss Bond off, big time. Having Felix Lieter maimed and his wife killed on their wedding day is inspired and immediately puts the film on a darker streak. The script here is very strong as we watch a darker more violent Bond infiltrate the bad guy's lifestyle and then proceed to work from there.

 Don't make any mistakes this is not a Bond film that would be broadcast during a Bank Holiday afternoon. What we have here is a film that is graphically violent. Check out the head explosion scene or the nasty incidents involving sharks. Having Bond on the revenge path makes for a more interesting tale than just another villain trying to take over the world. The more personal element fits in with this more darker Bond. Dalton really rises to the occasion here and ensures that he will be remembered as a fine actor who played the part of James Bond. The ice cool look of anger as he dumps a bad guy into a shark tank with a case fool of money is fantastic as is his reaction to finding Lieter's dead wife. It may not be said, buy OHMSS is being referenced. Helping Dalton along the way is a great support cast. Robert Davi is superb as Franz Sanchez, without doubt the nastiest Bond villain there has ever been. We have two Bond girls too. Talisa Soto is beautifully sultry, but Carey Lowell just pips her to the post as Pam Bouvier who really gives Bond a run for his money. Another great casting point is an increased role for Q. Desmond Lewellyn appears here more than he ever has done before, helping out in the mission that makes one wonder the Bond writers never thought of it before, or why they never did it after.

Licence To Kill is classic Bond. Purists may give of with the more American touch to the narrative (you just know that any theatrical trailer is crying out for voice over man to go "this time it's personal"), but the more darker narrative suits the film and it shows that Dalton was a good Bond no matter what his critics say. With some of the most spectacular action sequences at the time, this is a genuine Bond classic.

Shaken and stirred most definitely.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":100484,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Thriller"],"datePublished":"1989-07-14","keywords":"personal vendetta,vengeance,drug cartel,official james bond series,felix leiter character","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Licence to Kill","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2476317465","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmFmMWVlNmEtZTQ5Zi00ZTBmLWFlMTgtZWQwODg1NTI1OWYxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmFmMWVlNmEtZTQ5Zi00ZTBmLWFlMTgtZWQwODg1NTI1OWYxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer 2 for Licence To Kill"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001096/","name":"Timothy Dalton"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001108/","name":"Robert Davi"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000508/","name":"Carey Lowell"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0322515/","name":"John Glen"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0024134/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054040/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0026841/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0933865/","name":"Michael G. IMDb data; ttnr: 0097742, Title: Licence to Kill, --- Description: Licence to Kill: Directed by John Glen. With Timothy Dalton, Carey Lowell, Robert Davi, Talisa Soto. A vengeful James Bond goes rogue to infiltrate and take down the organization of a drug lord who has murdered his friend's new wife and left him near-death." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0097742/","name":"Licence to Kill","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODY3M2I0NGItYzJhNy00M2NiLThhMDgtNjZkNjA1NTQzMDM4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTIzOTk5ODM@._V1_.jpg","description":"A vengeful James Bond goes rogue to infiltrate and take down the organization of a drug lord who has murdered his friend's new wife and left him near-death.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0097742/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"eamon-hennedy","dateCreated":"2003-10-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"CLASSIC BOND!","reviewBody":"I really liked Timothy Dalton as Bond. I really thought the guy did a great job. The Living Daylights was an excellent Bond thriller, more in line with Dr No and From Russia With Love in tone and style, but with Licence To Kill you can tell that Broccoli decided to compete with the big boys with this action packed spectacular that aims high and scores. What we have here is Bond with spectacular action scenes and a more nastier steak with regards to the violence that is more in line with Hollywood action blockbusters than with quintessential British spies. This is why the film works. Licence To Kill is much more darker than any of the Bond films that has come before, and after the silliness of the Moore era, that was what this franchise needed. Why have world domination craving villains when you can just p*ss Bond off, big time. Having Felix Lieter maimed and his wife killed on their wedding day is inspired and immediately puts the film on a darker streak. The script here is very strong as we watch a darker more violent Bond infiltrate the bad guy's lifestyle and then proceed to work from there.

 Don't make any mistakes this is not a Bond film that would be broadcast during a Bank Holiday afternoon. What we have here is a film that is graphically violent. Check out the head explosion scene or the nasty incidents involving sharks. Having Bond on the revenge path makes for a more interesting tale than just another villain trying to take over the world. The more personal element fits in with this more darker Bond. Dalton really rises to the occasion here and ensures that he will be remembered as a fine actor who played the part of James Bond. The ice cool look of anger as he dumps a bad guy into a shark tank with a case fool of money is fantastic as is his reaction to finding Lieter's dead wife. It may not be said, buy OHMSS is being referenced. Helping Dalton along the way is a great support cast. Robert Davi is superb as Franz Sanchez, without doubt the nastiest Bond villain there has ever been. We have two Bond girls too. Talisa Soto is beautifully sultry, but Carey Lowell just pips her to the post as Pam Bouvier who really gives Bond a run for his money. Another great casting point is an increased role for Q. Desmond Lewellyn appears here more than he ever has done before, helping out in the mission that makes one wonder the Bond writers never thought of it before, or why they never did it after.

Licence To Kill is classic Bond. Purists may give of with the more American touch to the narrative (you just know that any theatrical trailer is crying out for voice over man to go "this time it's personal"), but the more darker narrative suits the film and it shows that Dalton was a good Bond no matter what his critics say. With some of the most spectacular action sequences at the time, this is a genuine Bond classic.

Shaken and stirred most definitely.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":100484,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Thriller"],"datePublished":"1989-07-14","keywords":"personal vendetta,vengeance,drug cartel,official james bond series,felix leiter character","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Licence to Kill","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2476317465","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmFmMWVlNmEtZTQ5Zi00ZTBmLWFlMTgtZWQwODg1NTI1OWYxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmFmMWVlNmEtZTQ5Zi00ZTBmLWFlMTgtZWQwODg1NTI1OWYxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer 2 for Licence To Kill","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001096/","name":"Timothy Dalton","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001108/","name":"Robert Davi","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000508/","name":"Carey Lowell"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0322515/","name":"John Glen"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0024134/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054040/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0026841/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0933865/","name":"Michael G. programme.title: Words on Bathroom Walls
Przewrotny umysł
Words on Bathroom Walls
programme.desc:
Words on Bathroom Walls: Directed by Thor Freudenthal. With Charlie Plummer, Andy Garcia, Taylor Russell, AnnaSophia Robb. Diagnosed with a mental illness halfway through his senior year of high school, a witty, introspective teen struggles to keep it a secret while falling in love with a brilliant classmate who inspires him to not be defined by his condition." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8045906/","name":"Words on Bathroom Walls","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTJmNTNlZDEtM2JjNy00MmNmLTgzNWItN2VlZGNlNjM1YjFmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTExMDk0NzQ3._V1_.jpg","description":"Diagnosed with a mental illness halfway through his senior year of high school, a witty, introspective teen struggles to keep it a secret while falling in love with a brilliant classmate who inspires him to not be defined by his cond","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8045906/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"TxMike"},"dateCreated":"2020-12-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"Teenager learns to cope with his schizophrenia.","reviewBody":"Curious title, it refers to both real words written on school bathroom walls, and even more the imaginary words he sees when he had bouts with his mental illness.

Based on the cast I figured this would be another mainly generic teenage rom-com. But it is just the opposite. While Adam (Charlie Plummer) starts a relationship with the bright girl in class after he asks her to tutor him, the story is overwhelmingly about Adam, and his family, and ultimately his school coming to grips with his schizophrenia.

Plummer is required to really stretch his acting chops and he does it well. The middle third of the movie is hard to watch at times but fortunately the final third starts to bring some healing.

Good movie, my wife and I watched it at home on DVD from our public library."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":7600,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2020-08-21","keywords":"based on young adult novel,schizophrenia,hallucination,hospital,restraint","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Watch Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3428105753","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjFiNDU4MzQtOGIzMS00ZGRmLWIzNTYtYmZjNmFhOGZlYzRhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXZ3ZXNsZXk@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjFiNDU4MzQtOGIzMS00ZGRmLWIzNTYtYmZjNmFhOGZlYzRhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXZ3ZXNsZXk@._V1_.jpg","description":"A teenager coping with paranoid schizophrenia hopes his new experimental drug treatment will help him navigate high school and the outside world."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4055138/","name":"Charlie Plummer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000412/","name":"Andy Garcia"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5347988/","name":"Taylor Russell"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0294457/","name":"Thor Freudenthal"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0811450/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0192696/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4550950/","name":"Nick Naveda"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm9649443/","name":"Julia Walton"}],"duration":"PT1H50M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Mordene i Kongo
Kongo
Mordene i Kongo
programme.desc:
Mordene i Kongo: Directed by Marius Holst. With Aksel Hennie, Tobias Santelmann, Ine F. Jansen, Dennis Storhøi. In the spring of 2009 two Norwegian adventurers, Joshua French and Tjostolv Moland, are accused of killing their hired chauffeur just before crossing into the eastern Congo. The following manhunt starts a political and diplomatic headache." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt7356382/","name":"Mordene i Kongo","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmE3ZDcyYzQtNDVlZS00MWQzLThkMzMtYzM5OWJmMjFkYzgwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODc0OTEyNDU@._V1_.jpg","description":"In the spring of 2009 two Norwegian adventurers, Joshua French and Tjostolv Moland, are accused of killing their hired chauffeur just before crossing into the eastern Congo. The following manhunt starts a political and diplomatic hea","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7356382/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ops-52535"},"dateCreated":"2019-02-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"a very special film","reviewBody":"This film is not a documentary, its not a biographical flick either, more a drama of true happenings based on books,interviews,family,friend,and statements given by moland and french, about what happened one fateful night in the jungle of civil war ridden democratic republic of congo in 2009. when launched in norwegian cinemas it recieved mixed to negative reviews by media and made great debate in norwegian public and social media. the main issue were that the filmmakers tried to accentuate mr moland and mr french as heroes.

what my personal view on the story is based on are the plentyful coverage made by norwegian broadcasters from the start til mr french got home to norway in 2017 as a relative free man. i shall also make a note that ive heard stories from personal friends with good connections both to the norwegian military and deep bonds to central african affairs that both mr french and mr moland were adrenalin seekers, well known mercinaries, very well seasoned within weapon use and warfare, and a pretty good example of ''brothers in arms''. if that is correct or not only history will tell, what i felt when the trials rolled on slow congolese pace were pittyness for them and especially their parents and families. so whats wrong or whats right,who knows, only joshua can tell because he is the only survivor of this drama. so i hope the congolese government uses the ransom money paid by the norwegian state to plant some ''joshua trees'' to make the blind man see and eventually climb down and give the victims, including mr moland some piece.

so This is a very inconclusive film when considering the guilt of crimes,that tjostolv moland and joshua french were accused for by congolese criminal courts.

but as a film it delivers brilliant acting, most of all by aksel hennie as mr french, and fulfilled by his coactor Tobias Santelmann as mr moland. the filmographic presentation are very good, the locations and production design are very truthfull and close up to the real world. the sound and some of the shooting scene made me jump on the sofa more than once. so wether you have heard about the case of them two norwegian mercenaries or not and want to enjoy a really well made film on low budget then watch this film by the director Marius Holst and his crew and 30-35 producers, because it makes tension into a new definition. very good and recommended.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1452,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.1},"genre":["Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2018-10-26","keywords":"manhunt,africa,congo,based on real people,based on real person","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0377336/","name":"Aksel Hennie"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4083737/","name":"Tobias Santelmann"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1262180/","name":"Ine F. Jansen"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0392319/","name":"Marius Holst"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0207853/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0662577/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0136790/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7251124/","name":"Stephen Uhlander"}],"duration":"PT2H2M"}</script><metacontent="
